intro: Ferula groessingii, commonly known as the Austrian cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to the Alps. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, spicy scent. Ferula groessingii is often found in rocky or alpine meadows, thriving in cool, moist environments.
